reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 217/18: COMPOSITION OF FIRST BOARD AND TRANSITION
reg_info.reg_name_text: COMPOSITION OF FIRST BOARD AND TRANSITION

content.content: 1. (1) The first board shall be composed of, (a) the external members set out under subsection (3); (b) any internal members appointed or elected in a manner described in subparagraph 1 ii, iii, iv or v of subsection 9 (1) of the Act; (c) if a chancellor of the University is appointed under section 30 of the Act, the chancellor; and (d) if a president of the University is appointed under section 31 of the Act, the president. (2) The members of the first board referred to in clause (1) (a) are deemed to be external members for the purposes of the Act, as though they were appointed under subparagraphs 2 ii and iii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act. (3) The following persons are appointed as external members of the first board: 1. Jean Michel Beck of Toronto. 2. Jacques Naud of Toronto. 3. Marie-Andrée Vermette of Toronto. 4. Dr. Dyane Adam, of Saint-François-de-l’Île-d’Orléans, Québec. 5. Normand Côté of Toronto. 6. Dr. Frédéric Dimanche of Toronto. 7. Dr. Marième Lo of Toronto. 8. Glenn O'Farrell of Toronto. 9. Rodrigue Gilbert of Markham. 10. Koubra Haggar of Hamilton. 11. Fété Kimpiobi of Welland. 12. Florence Ngenzebuhoro of Oakville.
content.raw_html:
1. (1) The first board shall be composed of,

(a) the external members set out under subsection (3);

(b) any internal members appointed or elected in a manner described in subparagraph 1 ii, iii, iv or v of subsection 9 (1) of the Act;

(c) if a chancellor of the University is appointed under section 30 of the Act, the chancellor; and

(d) if a president of the University is appointed under section 31 of the Act, the president.

(2) The members of the first board referred to in clause (1) (a) are deemed to be external members for the purposes of the Act, as though they were appointed under subparagraphs 2 ii and iii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act.

(3) The following persons are appointed as external members of the first board:

1. Jean Michel Beck of Toronto.

2. Jacques Naud of Toronto.

3. Marie-Andrée Vermette of Toronto.

4. Dr. Dyane Adam, of Saint-François-de-l’Île-d’Orléans, Québec.

5. Normand Côté of Toronto.

6. Dr. Frédéric Dimanche of Toronto.

7. Dr. Marième Lo of Toronto.

8. Glenn O'Farrell of Toronto.

9. Rodrigue Gilbert of Markham.

10. Koubra Haggar of Hamilton.

11. Fété Kimpiobi of Welland.

12. Florence Ngenzebuhoro of Oakville.

content.section: Appointment of chancellor by first board
content.content: 2. Subsections 30 (2), (3) and (4) of the Act do not apply to the appointment of a chancellor by the first board.
content.raw_html: 2. Subsections 30 (2), (3) and (4) of the Act do not apply to the appointment of a chancellor by the first board.

content.content: 3. (1) If the seat of a member of the first board appointed under subsection 1 (3) becomes vacant, the vacancy may only be filled by the Minister pursuant to clause 19 (1) (b) of the Act. (2) If a chancellor or president is a member of the first board, any vacancy in that person’s seat shall be filled in accordance with the Act. (3) If the seat of an internal member of the first board referred to in clause 1 (1) (b) becomes vacant, the vacancy shall be filled in accordance with the following rules: 1. A vacancy of a person appointed by the president of the University must be filled by another such appointment, as described in subparagraph 1 ii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act. 2. A vacancy of a member of the teaching staff must be filled by another member of the teaching staff, as described in subparagraph 1 iii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act. 3. A vacancy of a student must be filled by another student, as described in subparagraph 1 iv of subsection 9 (1) of the Act. 4. A vacancy of a non-teaching employee must be filled by another non-teaching employee, as described in subparagraph 1 v of subsection 9 (1) of the Act.
content.raw_html:
3. (1) If the seat of a member of the first board appointed under subsection 1 (3) becomes vacant, the vacancy may only be filled by the Minister pursuant to clause 19 (1) (b) of the Act.

(2) If a chancellor or president is a member of the first board, any vacancy in that person’s seat shall be filled in accordance with the Act.

(3) If the seat of an internal member of the first board referred to in clause 1 (1) (b) becomes vacant, the vacancy shall be filled in accordance with the following rules:

1. A vacancy of a person appointed by the president of the University must be filled by another such appointment, as described in subparagraph 1 ii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act.

2. A vacancy of a member of the teaching staff must be filled by another member of the teaching staff, as described in subparagraph 1 iii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act.

3. A vacancy of a student must be filled by another student, as described in subparagraph 1 iv of subsection 9 (1) of the Act.

4. A vacancy of a non-teaching employee must be filled by another non-teaching employee, as described in subparagraph 1 v of subsection 9 (1) of the Act.

content.content: 4. (1) The first board shall become the board constituted under section 9 of the Act on the later of, (a) January 15, 2019; and (b) the first day on which all of the following conditions have been met, as determined by the Minister: (i) At least one member of the first board is a person referred to in clause 1 (1) (b) or (d) of this Regulation. (ii) A resolution has been adopted by the first board declaring that all necessary by-laws have been passed to enable the self-governance of the board. (iii) A resolution has been adopted by the first board declaring that it has adopted policies to ensure compliance with any directives issued under subsection 10 (1) or 12 (1) of the Broader Public Sector Accountability Act, 2010. (iv) The first board has a written executive compensation program that complies with Ontario Regulation 304/16 (Executive Compensation Framework) made under the Broader Public Sector Executive Compensation Act, 2014. (v) The University is designated as an institution for the purposes of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act. (vi) The University has a sexual violence policy that complies with the requirements in subsection 17 (3) of the Ministry of Training, Colleges and Universities Act. O. Reg. 387/18, s. 1 (1). (1.1) The Minister shall inform the first board of the day determined under clause (1) (b). O. Reg. 387/18, s. 1 (1). (2) On the day the first board becomes the board constituted under section 9 of the Act, the following rules apply with respect to the members of the board appointed under subsection 1 (3): 1. The persons referred to in paragraphs 1 to 3 of subsection 1 (3) are deemed to be members of the board appointed by the Lieutenant Governor in Council under subparagraph 2 ii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act for a term of three years that is deemed to have started on the day section 19 of the Act came into force. 2. The persons referred to in paragraphs 4 to 8 of subsection 1 (3) are deemed to be members of the board appointed by the board under subparagraph 2 iii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act for a term of three years that is deemed to have started on the day section 19 of the Act came into force. 3. The persons referred to in paragraphs 9 to 12 of subsection 1 (3) are deemed to be members of the board appointed by the board under subparagraph 2 iii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act for a term of two years that is deemed to have started on the day section 19 of the Act came into force. O. Reg. 217/18, s. 4 (2); O. Reg. 387/18, s. 1 (2).
content.raw_html:
4. (1) The first board shall become the board constituted under section 9 of the Act on the later of,

(a) January 15, 2019; and

(b) the first day on which all of the following conditions have been met, as determined by the Minister:

(i) At least one member of the first board is a person referred to in clause 1 (1) (b) or (d) of this Regulation.

(ii) A resolution has been adopted by the first board declaring that all necessary by-laws have been passed to enable the self-governance of the board.

(iii) A resolution has been adopted by the first board declaring that it has adopted policies to ensure compliance with any directives issued under subsection 10 (1) or 12 (1) of the Broader Public Sector Accountability Act, 2010.

(iv) The first board has a written executive compensation program that complies with Ontario Regulation 304/16 (Executive Compensation Framework) made under the Broader Public Sector Executive Compensation Act, 2014.

(v) The University is designated as an institution for the purposes of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

(vi) The University has a sexual violence policy that complies with the requirements in subsection 17 (3) of the Ministry of Training, Colleges and Universities Act. O. Reg. 387/18, s. 1 (1).

(1.1) The Minister shall inform the first board of the day determined under clause (1) (b). O. Reg. 387/18, s. 1 (1).

(2) On the day the first board becomes the board constituted under section 9 of the Act, the following rules apply with respect to the members of the board appointed under subsection 1 (3):

1. The persons referred to in paragraphs 1 to 3 of subsection 1 (3) are deemed to be members of the board appointed by the Lieutenant Governor in Council under subparagraph 2 ii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act for a term of three years that is deemed to have started on the day section 19 of the Act came into force.

2. The persons referred to in paragraphs 4 to 8 of subsection 1 (3) are deemed to be members of the board appointed by the board under subparagraph 2 iii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act for a term of three years that is deemed to have started on the day section 19 of the Act came into force.

3. The persons referred to in paragraphs 9 to 12 of subsection 1 (3) are deemed to be members of the board appointed by the board under subparagraph 2 iii of subsection 9 (1) of the Act for a term of two years that is deemed to have started on the day section 19 of the Act came into force. O. Reg. 217/18, s. 4 (2); O. Reg. 387/18, s. 1 (2).
